title: Ronald Koeman says he doesn't need a new deal to reaffirm Everton commitment amid Barcelona rumours
text:
Sport Ronald Koeman says he doesn't need a new deal to reaffirm Everton commitment amid Barcelona rumours The Toffees boss has been linked with a move to the Nou Camp but wants trophies at Goodison Share Ronald Koeman has again been linked with his former club (Photo: Everton FC/Getty Images) Share Get FC Barcelona   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ronald Koeman has insisted he doesn’t need a new contract to confirm his commitment to Everton . 
Instead – in the face of fresh reports of Barcelona interest in the Nou Camp legend as their next manager – the Dutchman suggested winning a trophy for the Blues is his way of proving he is looking long-term. 
Speaking about the latest speculation in Spain, which claims Koeman, who was the matchwinner in Barca’s first European Cup triumph, is on a shortlist to replace boss Luis Enrique, he said of a new contract: “Not now, no. 
“You don’t sign a new contract in your first season if you have three seasons of contract. Ronald Koeman has targeted trophies at Everton (Photo: Alex Livesey / Getty) 
“No, no let’s wait and see what happens in the future.” 
What Koeman wants to happen is to steer Everton into a position where they can be genuine contenders to win a trophy – which they can’t be this term. 
As they prepare to entertain old boss David Moyes and several former players to Goodison for the visit of Sunderland today, Koeman was asked if this season could still be a success by finishing in the top six. 
He said: “That is still not a success. There are 13 games to play. The players need time to adapt to how we like to play and train and work together, but it is going well. Koeman was a crowd favourite at the Nou Camp (Photo: Getty) Read More Everton had January bid rejected for Wayne Rooney 
“If I compare the intensity in training to the pre-season and the start of the season it is a big difference. 
“Europe is a factor though, because players like to be part of Europe, and like to be part of Champions League. 
“That is the best for football players, but will normally be impossible. 
“The first step is to be part of Europe, even if it means playing on Thursday in a difficult league, because to be part of it is the next step towards winning.” poll loading Will Ronald Koeman one day manage Barcelona? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
